channel.title: Measures against coold boot attack
channel.description: there is th idea of a panic button that whipes the whole ram. how long would that take? is there a command/feature/bug that lets the ram module whipe its memory without having to access each address? if whiping takes too long would it be better to have a laptop run with unscrewed ram cover and in an emergency rip out the module(s) and break them?

item.title: Measures against coold boot attack
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
how long would that take?
Not too long. RAM is fast.
is there a command/feature/bug that lets the ram module whipe its memory without having to access each address?
Not that I know.
if whiping takes too long would it be better to have a laptop run with unscrewed ram cover and in an emergency rip out the module(s) and break them?
Probably not.

[hr]

This is something that host operating systems such as Debian and Fedora would have to implement. Someone could take http://git.tails.boum.org/wiperam/, polish, and upload to Debian.
